page.title: 17Landscape
page.content: Apart from the modern housing estates, and a small amount of development on the Kirton and Falkenham road, the area is rural and mainly flat except in the area of the Sink.There are both old and modern barns and farm buildings scattered over the landscape. The land slopes gently down to river level and the low lying land has been drained by dykes. The River Deben is contained by high wide earth banks which have recently been reviewed and strengthened. On the riverside mud flats are revealed at low tide and in the river itself there are moorings for many small craft.
